title: Conducting a systematic review
description: In this guide we explore each stage of carrying out a systematic review from forming and refining your question to managing and reporting your results.

title: Copyright essentials for teaching
description: In this guide we will introduce you to the basics of copyright including using other people’s work, getting permission, and how you can safely use literary works, images, and video in your teaching whilst adhering to copyright law.

title: Getting started with searching Fame
description: In this guide we will introduce you to the Fame business database for researching companies in the United Kingdom and Republic of Ireland.

title: Searching systematically
description: In this guide you will explore four databases which will help you to find and refine your results to helping you through the process of searching systematically.

title: Library support for Business Data
description: In this guide you will find support links for various topics relating to business data. Use the links at the top to navigate to each topic and access guides, podcasts, videos and workshops.

title: Getting started searching for business data and literature
description: In this guide, we explore where you can find various types of business data and literature for free using the University of Manchester Library.

title: Glossary of advanced searching
description: In this post we explore the meaning of various terms used in searching and advanced searching of information.

title: Critical appraisal for medicine and health sciences
description: In this post we explore the process of critical appraisal, types of study and the key areas to examine when appraising a research article.

title: Preparing to use Eventus and converting the results
description: In this post we show you how to form your data to use the Eventus event study tool, and how to access the data it returns.

title: Getting started with Capital IQ Pro
description: In this post we will explore how to get started with using Capital IQ Pro for finding worldwide private company data.

title: Systematic review: organising your keywords and subject terms
description: In this post we will explore the keywords and subject headings that you will use to support the early scoping exercises and subsequent literature reviews. We will also explore how MeSH and MeSH trees can help you to  collect, organise and present your search terms.

title: Capital IQ Bman2 2 Searching
description: Introduction of searching a company in Capital IQ.

description: Overview of EBSCO’s advantages with a demonstration of its core search tools..

description: Shows how to store and organise your OVID search histories for long projects.

title: Using Truncation in Ebsco
description: Shows how to use truncation in EBSCO databases to broaden your keyword search.

title: Creating Groups In Endnote
description: Step by step guide to managing reference collections in EndNote by creating groups with specific tops such as authors or journals.

title: Why should I use Web of Science
description: The benefits of using Web of Science for impactful academic research.

title: Microsoft 365 Fundamentals Certification
description: The University of Manchester is providing students with the opportunity to study for and receive a Microsoft 365 Fundamentals Certification free-of-charge. This guide contains all of the information you will need to prepare and take an exam.

title: Library support for Digital Skills
description: This guide brings together all the Library’s support for developing your digital skills. You’ll find resources to help you assess and improve your digital capabilities, explore LinkedIn Learning for expert-led courses, and understand how to use Artificial Intelligence ethically in your studies.

title: Using Bloomberg Professional
description: This guide covers key topics for using Bloomberg Professional. It begins with using the Bloomberg terminal and keyboard to access company financial data, news, and custom company lists.

title: Searching effectively
description: This guide introduces key strategies for refining search results, including keyword planning, Boolean operators, and advanced techniques for web and database searches. It also highlights how to evaluate sources for reliability and relevance, helping you to find trustworthy, high-quality information efficiently.

title: Getting started with EndNote Desktop
description: This guide is useful for anyone wanting to use EndNote Desktop to collect, manage, and format references in order to cite and reference sources.

title: Getting started with EndNote Online
description: This guide is useful for anyone wanting to use EndNote Online to collect, manage, and format references in order to cite and reference sources.

title: Copyright Guidance at The University of Manchester
description: This guide will help you to find out how copyright affects your work, research and study here at the University of Manchester.

title: Searching and exporting your results from OVID
description: This guide will take you through how to search OVID effectively including using Medical Subject Headings, exporting your results for de-duplication and sharing your search strategy to request further help and support.

title: Copyright for students: Who owns what?
description: This resource provides a basic introduction to copyright, whilst looking how it can affect you as a student.

title: Library support for Referencing
description: This set of resources will show you how to reference different types of sources in your assignments. It will help you to cite, paraphrase and manage your references using tools such as EndNote, Endnote online and Mendeley.

title: Library support for Advanced searching
description: This set of resources will show you introduce you to medical and health sciences databases. It will help you with searching, refining and your results as well as accessing further support from experts.

title: Copyright for teaching materials: can I use it?
description: This short online resource will help you to determine whether you can use specific types of material in your teaching, without breaching copyright.

title: Adding Additional Variables To Your Screen And Exporting
description: Tips for using S&P Capital IQ: Adding variables and exporting.

title: Searching in Web of Science
description: Walkthrough of conducting detailed searches in Web of Science.

title: Why should I use Ebsco
description: Why EBSCO is a good platform for academic research and literature discovery.
